translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs
The Group of Ones with Nine or Ten Rains
The Elder Nun Saḷalapupphikā’s Verses
On the bank of the Candabhāgā River,
I was a kinnarī then.
I saw the god of gods,
the bull of men, walking up and down.

analyzed: ocinitvāna saḷala  buddha seṭṭhaḥ sadā saha
translated: Having picked a saḷala flower,🔽I always served the best Buddha.
The great hero Upasiṅgha,
the saḷala flower, divine perfume.
Having accepted it, the Buddha,
Vipassī, the leader of the world,
The great hero Upasiṅgha,
while I was looking on then.
Having raised my hands in respectful salutation,
and worshipped the supreme human,
having gladdened my own mind,
I then climbed the mountain.
For ninety-one eons,
the flower intoxication I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical knowledges,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ saḷalapupphikā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam saḷalapupphikā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: The Story of the Elder Nun Sallapupphaka is finished.
The Second Portion for Recital is finished.
